newsitem.title: INDIA: India tribal rebels kill three after murder.
newsitem.headline: India tribal rebels kill three after murder.

text.p: Separatist guerrillas in the northeastern Indian state of Nagaland killed three youths believed to have murdered a teacher at Pallons in Tamenglong district, United News of India (UNI) said on Wednesday.

The news agency quoted a National Socialist Council of Nagaland (NSCN) statement as saying the youths robbed and killed a teacher of Ngaikhong high school on his way to Tamenglong on August 4 with 20,000 rupees ($560) to buy timber.
The NSCN "registered a case" against the youths before killing them last Monday. UNI did not say how the guerrillas carried out the punishment.
Rebels in remote Nagaland, which borders Burma, have been fighting for an independent homeland for more than 40 years.
